intro: Trigonella pes-avium, commonly known as wild fenugreek, is a flowering plant belonging to the Fabaceae family. It is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in wet meadows and along stream banks. Its seeds are small and oblong, containing compounds that have been studied for their potential medicinal properties. Trigonella pes-avium plays a role in supporting local biodiversity and is sometimes used in traditional herbal remedies.
